title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 633.3 - Reapportionment of Title XX funds
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 633.3 - Reapportionment of Title XX funds

State Regulations
(a) After the end of each Federal fiscal
year, the amount of Title XX funds expended by each district shall be
calculated by the department. (b) Any unused Title XX funds will be reallocated proportionally among the local
districts whose claims have exceeded their Title XX ceilings. (c) The amounts to be reallocated pursuant to
subdivision (b) of this section must be determined by the following process: (1)

The total of the unexpended Title XX
funds will be determined on the basis of claims, adjustments and disallowances
processed for a Federal fiscal year that were received no later than six months
following the close of such Federal fiscal year. (2)

The department will determine the amount
of the unexpended Title XX funds for those districts which had not exceeded
their Title XX ceiling and establish the total statewide unexpended Title XX
funds. (3)

The department will
determine the amount of overexpended Title XX funds for those districts which
had exceeded their Title XX ceiling and establish the amount of the total
statewide overexpended Title XX funds. (4)

The department will establish the
reallocation percentage by dividing the total unexpended Title XX funds by the
total overexpended Title XX funds. (5)

The department will establish the
reapportionment amount due those districts which have exceeded their Title XX
ceiling by multiplying the reallocation percentage by the amount each district
exceeded its Title XX ceiling. (d) The amount of Title XX funds to be
reallocated pursuant to subdivision (c) of this section will be the final
allocation of Title XX funds made to a local social services district. No
further reallocation of Title XX funds will be made to the local districts for
a particular Federal fiscal year. (e) On the basis of the final apportionment
of Title XX funds to be made available to social services districts, payments
will be processed by the department which will be reflected on the districts'
settlement notices. Notes

633.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
